highlights: Design, build, and maintain a suite of software products used to support CGM products throughout product life-cycle, notably in R&D and clinical trials.
Maintain the CI infrastructure for the firmware and firmware tools teams.
Lead junior developers and interview for open requisitions.
Developed and maintained an application for engineers, technicians, and management for commercial HVAC assembly.
Switched the team from SVN to Git VC. Implemented a TFS server for CI.
Developed components for an internal UI library to be used across a new wave of Thomson Reuters applications.
Worked in Agile and Kanban teams to implement aforementioned library components into two new Thomson Reuters applications.
Hosted developer learning sessions relating to Angular practices
Worked with the R&D team to help develop a Tableau Forensic Imager. Mostly worked on UI and helped with some business logic.
Hosted monthly on-campus tech workshops and events.
Worked alongside Microsoft professionals to bring new and exciting programming content to students.
Expanded an existing community of students and faculty that have a love for technology.

projects.name: Magic Mirror
projects.description: A raspberry pi-powered smart mirror to display my email, to-do list, weather, do my bidding, etc.

projects.name: Forestry Conservaton Undergraduate Research
projects.description: A collaboration between the Biology + CS departments to create a model that simulates the spread of the Chestnut Blight Fungus

awards.title: Local 1st Place - ACM NCNA Programming Contest
awards.summary: Member of the highest ranking team at UW-L
